pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:0.5: 25. The training rule on squatting on the heels
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were squatting on their heels while walking in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.3: “‘I will not squat on my heels while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.4: Walking in an inhabited area, one should not squat on one’s heels.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, squats on his heels while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.7: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:1.9: The fifth training rule is finished.
